Hi, Dirk. The Junit++ extension (a.k.a. JUNITPP) which is available 
at junit.org is very helpful for repeating the same tests x number of 
times, and you could easily add a wait time to the code that controls 
the repetition--but I think they've only extended the non-GUI 
TestRunner. At the very least, taking a look at JunitPP might be a 
place to begin heading in the right direction. - DJ

--- In junit@y..., "LECLUSE Dirk (BMB)" <dirk.lecluse@p...> wrote:
> Hello,
> 
> Was wondering if there exists a JUnit extension that allows JUnit 
to run
> tests every x minutes (every eg 30 minutes).
> Preferable this would run in a JUnit GUI like 
junit.swingui.TestRunner, but
> with the option to check-enable repeatative testing, and specify an 
interval
> like every x minutes.
> 
> Repeatative testing is interesting to check a development that 
depends on
> several dependancies (legacy applications) that tend to change over 
time (eg
> go down, be modified, etc)
> 
> I experimented to implement/extend junit.swingui.TestRunner but 
without a
> lot of success so far.
> 
> Any suggestions are welcomed.
> Thanks,
> 
> Dirk Lecluse
